faqs.question: Могут ли иностранцы купить недвижимость в Испании?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. EU citizens, UK nationals, and international buyers from any country have identical rights to purchase Spanish real estate. No visa or residency requirement exists to buy property; you need only a Spanish tax identification number (NIE) and professional legal representation. The process is straightforward with established legal frameworks protecting all purchasers.

faqs.question: Каковы расходы на покупку недвижимости в Испании?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically range 6-10% above property price, including: transfer tax (6-11% depending on region—7% in Alicante), notary fees (€800-1,500), property registry fees (€200-400), and legal advisor fees (€1,000-2,000). For this €514,000 property, expect total acquisition costs of approximately €30,000-50,000. Professional advisors should provide detailed cost projections before proceeding with purchase.

faqs.question: Какова стоимость жизни на Коста-Бланке?
faqs.answer: Cost of living is considerably lower than Northern Europe. Monthly expenses for a couple typically range €1,200-1,800, including utilities, groceries, dining out, and entertainment. Healthcare and education are affordable; utilities cost €100-150 monthly; groceries cost 30-40% less than UK prices. Lifestyle expenses (golf, restaurants, leisure) can be managed at various levels. Established expatriate budgets demonstrate comfortable living is achievable at modest expense levels compared to home countries.

faqs.question: Нужна ли мне виза для покупки недвижимости в Испании?
faqs.answer: No, you do not require a visa to purchase Spanish property. Property ownership is separate from residency and immigration status. However, if you intend to spend significant time in Spain (183+ days annually), you may need appropriate visa or residency documentation. EU citizens enjoy freedom of movement; other nationalities should consult their embassy regarding residency options. Property purchase itself requires only legal representation and financial arrangements.

faqs.question: Сколько составляет налог на недвижимость в Испании?
faqs.answer: Ежегодные налоги на недвижимость (IBI) on Spanish property typically range 0.4-1.1% of cadastral value (which often differs from purchase price). For this property, expect approximately €200-400 annually. Capital gains tax (19-45% depending on ownership duration and circumstances) applies when selling, though principal residences receive favorable treatment. Non-resident property owners pay annual wealth tax on properties exceeding €600,000 value. Professional advisors should clarify tax implications before purchase.

faqs.question: Могу ли я получить ипотеку в Испании как иностранец?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers can obtain Spanish mortgages through established banks. Typically, banks offer 60-70% loan-to-value financing for property purchases, with interest rates competitive with European standards (currently 3.5-5% range). You will need Spanish tax identification (NIE), proof of income, and employment verification. British and EU citizens have established mortgage access; other nationalities should confirm bank availability. Many international buyers combine Spanish mortgages with UK equity release for optimal financing.

faqs.question: Какая погода на Коста-Бланке?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with over 320 days of sunshine annually. Summers are warm (28-32°C/82-90°F) with low rainfall; winters are mild (8-15°C/46-59°F) with occasional rain. Ciudad Quesada's elevated position provides natural breezes avoiding excessive summer heat. The region is considerably warmer and sunnier than Northern Europe throughout the year, making it ideal for outdoor living. Occasional winter storms are brief; snow is extremely rare even at higher elevations.

faqs.question: How far is Costa Blanca from UK?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is 1,000 kilometers south of the UK. Direct flights from Alicante Airport (45km from this property) to London and regional UK airports take approximately 2-2.5 hours. Flights are frequent and affordable; return flights often cost €60-120. Ferry options from France take 24+ hours. The proximity makes Costa Blanca ideal for UK buyers maintaining family connections while enjoying Mediterranean lifestyle; frequent visits are practical and affordable.
